column1: Art Institute of Chicago////I know that sounds like complaining but it's not meant to be. I am so glad we have aged
column2: character-ridden buildings to view the art in context rather than shiny new housing which would feel directly contrasted to the ornate gilded frames of El Greco and Rembrandt. The Modern Wing does a lovely job of putting the moderns first
column3: with its sparse architecture and perfect use of natural light.
